name: spansnsh

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, chba), wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), csh), wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), cch))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chba), wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), csh))
-| wi(wcel(c0, chba), wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), cch))
-| wi(wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), cch), wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), csh))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ ~H →(span ` { c0 })∈ SH)
⊣ (c0 ∈ ~H →(span ` { c0 })∈ CH)
⊣ ((span ` { c0 })∈ CH →(span ` { c0 })∈ SH)

-| wi(wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), cch), wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), csh))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ ~H →(span ` { c0 })∈ SH)
⊣ (c0 ∈ ~H →(span ` { c0 })∈ CH)
⊣ ((span ` { c0 })∈ CH →(span ` { c0 })∈ SH)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chba), wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), csh))
-| wi(wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), cch), wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), csh))

body.origin: |- wi(wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), cch), wcel(cfv(cspn, csn(c0)), csh))

comment: The span of a Hilbert space singleton is a subspace. (Contributed by NM, 17-Dec-2004.) (New usage is discouraged.)
